featured.text: At the very beginning, only 33 names were used because at that time typhoons were named after girlfriends or wives of the experts on the committee.
Since Michael was the best candidate, the committee voted for him to take charge of the company’s sales department.
To support refugees and people facing crises around the world, the International Olympic Committee created the Refugee Olympic Team.
The list-based convention, on the other hand, is based on the list of typhoon names compiled in advance by a committee, and is more widely used.

other.text: Mr. Wang’s arguments were very , and the committee finally accepted his proposal.
To have a full discussion of the issue, the committee spent a whole hour _____ their ideas at the meeting.
In most cases, the committee members can reach agreement quickly. _____, however, they differ greatly in opinion and have a hard time making decisions.
The names were chosen from a name pool 36 of 140 names, 10 each from the 14 members of the committee.
The proposal Mr. Lin ______ last week has very little chance of being accepted by the committee.
On June 19, 2001, an agreement was signed between the International Olympic Committee and the International Paralympics Committee to keep this 30 in the future.
In Asia, Western names were used until 2000 when the committee decided to use Asian names to 35 Asians’ awareness of typhoons.
If a member country suffers great damage from a certain typhoon, it can 39 that the name of the typhoon be deleted from the list at the annual committee meeting.

definition.zh_def: 委員會；由一群人組成，負責特定任務或決策的組織。
definition.en_def: A group of people appointed for a specific function, typically consisting of members from a larger organization.
definition.example: The committee will meet next week to discuss the new policy.
